co.louiscap.lib.compat.lexical

Class LexicalToken<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • co.louiscap.lib.compat.lexical.LexicalToken<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The data type that this lexical token holds. Provided mostly as a convenience; only affects get/set methods for the user value
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    NamedValue<T>

    public class LexicalToken<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements NamedValue<T>
    A token that represents an atomic lexical unit. Also holds information about the lexical unit.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String DEFAULT_NAMESPACE
      The default namespace given to tokens that are defined without one.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LexicalToken(java.lang.String name)
      Create a new Token in the default namespace
      LexicalToken(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String namespace)
      Create a new Token within the specified namespace.
      LexicalToken(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String namespace, T value)
      Create a new Token within the specified namespace, and with the given data.

      Sets the value represented by this object
      static LexicalToken tokenFromString(java.lang.String data)
      Turns a string into a LexicalToken as per fromString(java.lang.String) but explicitely returns a LexicalToken instead of a NamedValue

    • Constructor Detail

      • LexicalToken

        public LexicalToken(java.lang.String name)
        Create a new Token in the default namespace
        Parameters:
        name - The identifying name of this token

      • LexicalToken

        public LexicalToken(java.lang.String name,
                    java.lang.String namespace)
        Create a new Token within the specified namespace. Two tokens with the same name (but which exist in different namespaces) can represent two entirely separate entities without conflict
        Parameters:
        name - The Identifying name of this token
        namespace - The namespace within which this token exists

      • LexicalToken

        public LexicalToken(java.lang.String name,
                    java.lang.String namespace,
                    T value)
        Create a new Token within the specified namespace, and with the given data. Two tokens with the same name (but which exist in different namespaces) can represent two entirely separate entities without conflict
        Parameters:
        name - The Identifying name of this token
        namespace - The namespace within which this token exists
        value - A user value that this token represents

    • Method Detail

      • valueToString

        protected java.lang.String valueToString(T val)
        Creates a reversible String representation of the specified token. Values that are not a boxed integer, float, long or double will be marked as strings. They will need to be deserialised separately after the full token has been decoded from a string.
        Parameters:
        val - The stringValue to turn into a String
        Returns:
        A String that represents the stringValue and stringValue type of the parameter provided.

public NamedValue fromString(java.lang.String data)
        Deprecated. 
        Description copied from interface: NamedValue

      • tokenFromString

        public static LexicalToken tokenFromString(java.lang.String data)
                                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Turns a string into a LexicalToken as per fromString(java.lang.String) but explicitely returns a LexicalToken instead of a NamedValue
        Parameters:
        data - A string that represents a LexicalToken, likely created by an invocation of serialise().
        Returns:
        A LexicalToken that represents the provided data
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the provided data doesn't have the correct token header
